page.title: 01GENERAL OVERVIEW
page.content: The area is rural and residential. The development mainly took place as a result of the Industrial revolution, with many small communities centred around mills. The Rivers played an important part in this although now only provide recreation and drinking water. The population is mainly fairly stable and there is a growth of infilling of housing. Almost all housing is in local stone and there is a conservation policy through the area plan on any building or development. Communications are easy and swift, mainly by road. There is a wide social and demographic spread of the population. There is concern over the decline of rural small communities owing to lack of employment, facilities and transport. It is a beautiful area to live in.
